parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided Facebook ad data does not contain a CMF number.  This is not conclusive evidence of non-propaganda, as CMF numbers are not always present in all forms of political advertising, especially those not directly tied to specific candidates.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post mentions "Alin Nicușcă," but without further context, it's unclear if this is a parliamentary candidate. The post uses Romanian and Hungarian, suggesting a focus on a specific region where this individual might be known.  Further investigation is needed to determine if this person is a candidate in the parliamentary elections.  If he is, Article 36 (7) - a would apply.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The ad targeted Covasna, Harghita, and Mureș counties in Romania, indicating an attempt to reach a wide audience within those regions.  The paid nature of the Facebook post further supports this conclusion.  Therefore, it addresses the wide population.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The message urges viewers to "vote on Sunday because later we cannot influence the decisions." This strongly suggests an electoral objective to influence voting behavior. The timing of the post is crucial; if it falls outside the official campaign period, it would be a violation.  Article 36 (7) - c applies.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The content does not appear to be journalistic in nature. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. The call to action ("Vote on Sunday") is explicitly partisan and aims to sway voters.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The statement is not a personal opinion; it's a direct appeal for voters to support a specific individual (Alin Nicușcă), even if his candidacy is not explicitly stated. The context strongly suggests an attempt to influence the election.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2723665604473614</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by RMDSZ, displays characteristics of electoral propaganda.  While it doesn't explicitly name a party, the call to vote on Sunday, coupled with the targeting of specific regions in Romania and the mention of "Alin Nicușcă," strongly suggests an attempt to influence the parliamentary elections.  The lack of a CMF number is not definitive, but the other factors heavily weigh towards this being a violation.  The post's objective is clearly to encourage voting for a specific individual, likely a candidate, thus fulfilling the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The timing of the post is critical; if it occurred after the official campaign period ended, it would be a clear violation of Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Alin Nicușcă</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>RMDSZ</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
RMDSZ, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 2723665604473614), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu mesajul "Alin Nicușcă: Közösségünk jövője forog kockán. Vasárnap szavazzunk, mert később nem tudjuk befolyásolni a döntéseket!", care îndeamnă la vot pentru un candidat neidentificat explicit, dar puternic sugerat prin contextul regional și temporal, având un efect electoral clar pozitiv asupra lui Alin Nicușcă.  Reclama, vizând județele Covasna, Harghita și Mureș, a atins o audiență estimată între 100.000 și 500.000 de persoane, cu cheltuieli sub 100 RON, conform datelor din Ad Library.  Această acțiune constituie propagandă electorală după încheierea perioadei legale, încălcând prevederile legale.  Datele de contact ale RMDSZ sunt disponibile pe pagina lor de Facebook și includ adresa de email kommunikacio@rmdsz.ro și numărul de telefon +40742125468.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
